alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rensselaer; Southeast Warren; Southern Washington; Western Rensselaer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 21 at 3:27AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON EDT TODAY THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central New York and southern Vermont, including the following areas, in east central New York, Eastern Albany, Eastern Rensselaer, Eastern Schenectady, Northern Saratoga, Northern Warren, Northern Washington, Southeast Warren, Southern Saratoga, Southern Washington, Western Albany, Western Rensselaer and Western Schenectady. In southern Vermont, Bennington, Eastern Windham and Western Windham. * WHEN...From Noon EDT today through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms will produce 1 to 3 inches of rain with isolated higher amounts. There is the potential for standing water in low lying areas and scattered flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rensselaer; Southeast Warren; Southern Washington; Western Rensselaer
